bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 1, 1897

div1.p: Lazear comments on life in Massachusetts. He provides family news and hopes that Sweitzer enjoys her time in Boston.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 1, 1897
div1.p:
Mabel came last
Thursday and we
have been out here
at Windsor ever
since. I do not
know how much
longer we shall
stay here. It has
been warm again.

Mabel is looking
very well. We do not
like the idea of opening
the house in town while
it is so hot.

Mabel thinks her mother
would like to go down
from Beverly when you
go to Boston, She thinks
it will be too cold
at Beverly by that
time. Mrs. Houston
understood that you
did not intend to go to Boston
until Oct. 1. Nellie Houston will
come to see us in October. She was
having a good time at Beverly
and all thought it better for her
not to come to Baltimore so early.

The boarding house at Beverly where
we staid, I cannot recommend.

It is Miss Caldwells. The situation
is beautiful and it all looks
neat and clean but the table is
abominable. There is another
where the Selhams staicy- Mrs. Williams.

It is half a block back from
the sea but a much more satisfactory
place.

Aunt Kate heard from Anne Orr
a few days ago. They
had received a telegram
from Uncle Tom saying
that Lytt was a little
better.

I am sure you will
enjoy your stop at
Boston. I will send
the Baedeker as soon
as you get there.

It has a good map
and description of the
city.

I do not know when the concerts
begin but you must inquire. They
have afternoon concerts.

The Trolley roads ran out from
Boston in all directions sometimes
going long distances. I am afraid
though that they will be cold
by the time you get there.

We shall have your room all
ready for you early in October.
